00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File:   func_list.h
00050  *
00051  *      Description: Function name list that offers quick access and removes 
00052  *                   the random renaming done on static function names.
00053  *
00054  *      Creation Date: June 1999
00055  *
00056  *      Authors: John C. Gyllenhaal and Wen-mei Hwu
00057  *
00058  *      Revisions:
00059  *
00060 \*****************************************************************************/
00061 
00062 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00063 #include <config.h>
00064 #include <stdio.h>
00065 #include <ctype.h>
00066 #include <library/i_error.h>
00067 #include "func_list.h"
00068 
00069 /* Returns the length of the function name that
00070  * should be considered during comparison, handling
00071  * EDG's renaming scheme for static variables:
00072  * foo_file_i_6543___FXxxxx
00073  *         ^------- last relevant character in name.
00074  *                 ^------ keys off of three ___
00075  * For non-static (and therefore non-renamed) function
00076  * names, this will return the same answer as strlen().
00077  * 
00078  * This function will consider whitespace a terminating
00079  * character, so that pointers into 'name_list' can
00080  * be passed to this function directly.
00081  */
00082 static int
00083 relevant_len (char *func_name)
00084 {
00085   int len, ren_len;
00086   char *ptr, *ren_ptr;
00087 
00088   len = 0;
00089   ptr = func_name;
00090 
00091   while ((*ptr != 0) && !isspace (*ptr))
00092     {
00093       /* Look for a digit followed by three '_', this should
00094        * signal a renaming has occured.  The minimum
00095        * pattern that will be matched is 'a_b_i_1___Fxx'
00096        *                                         ^---
00097        * So no need to test until character 8 (len == 7).
00098        */
00099       if ((len >= 7) &&
00100           (ptr[0] == '_') &&
00101           (ptr[1] == '_') && (ptr[2] == '_') && (isdigit (ptr[-1])))
00102         {
00103           /* Goto just before number:
00104            *   'a_b_i_1___Fxx'
00105            *         ^------
00106            */
00107           ren_ptr = ptr - 1;
00108           ren_len = len - 1;
00109           while ((ren_len >= 5) && isdigit (ren_ptr[0]))
00110             {
00111               ren_ptr--;
00112               ren_len--;
00113             }
00114 
00115           /* Do we have match? */
00116           if ((ren_ptr[0] == '_') &&
00117               (ren_ptr[-1] == 'i') && (ren_ptr[-2] == '_'))
00118             {
00119               /* Yes, return length until first '_':
00120                *    'a_b_i_1___Fxx'
00121                *        ^---------- (return 4 here)
00122                */
00123               return (ren_len - 1);
00124             }
00125         }
00126       ptr++;
00127       len++;
00128     }
00129 
00130   return (len);
00131 }
00132 
00133 /* Create function name list from space separated list of
00134  * function names, that may have EDG's renaming performed
00135  * on them (if static function names).
00136  */
00137 Func_Name_List *
00138 new_Func_Name_List (char *name_list)
00139 {
00140   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *name_table;
00141   char *ptr;
00142   int len;
00143 
00144   name_table = CHAR_ARRAY_new_symbol_table ("Func_Name_List", 0);
00145 
00146   /* Put the relevant portion of each name in the table */
00147   if ((ptr = name_list))
00148     {
00149       while (*ptr != 0)
00150         {
00151           /* Strip leading whitespace */
00152           if (isspace (*ptr))
00153             {
00154               ptr++;
00155               continue;
00156             }
00157 
00158           /* Get relevant length of name */
00159           len = relevant_len (ptr);
00160 
00161           /* Sanity check, better be > 1 */
00162           if (len < 1)
00163             I_punt ("new_Func_Name_List: len 0 unexpected!\n");
00164           
00165           /* Add if not already in table */
00166           if (CHAR_ARRAY_find_symbol (name_table, ptr, len) == NULL)
00167             {
00168               CHAR_ARRAY_add_symbol (name_table, ptr, len, NULL);
00169             }
00170           
00171           /* Goto next name */
00172           while ((*ptr != 0) && !isspace (*ptr))
00173             ptr++;
00174           
00175           while ((*ptr != 0) && isspace (*ptr))
00176             ptr++;
00177         }
00178     }
00179 
00180   /* Return name table as function list */
00181   return ((Func_Name_List *) name_table);
00182 }
00183 
00184 /* Delete list using table delete routine */
00185 void *
00186 delete_Func_Name_List (Func_Name_List * list)
00187 {
00188   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *table;
00189 
00190   /* Sanity check */
00191   if (list == NULL)
00192     I_punt ("delete_Func_Name_List: list is NULL!");
00193 
00194   table = (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *) list;
00195   CHAR_ARRAY_delete_symbol_table (table, NULL);
00196   return (NULL);
00197 }
00198 
00199 /* Returns 1 if the relevant portion of func_name is in
00200  * the function list.
00201  */
00202 int
00203 is_in_Func_Name_List (Func_Name_List * list, char *func_name)
00204 {
00205   int len;
00206   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *table;
00207 
00208   /* Sanity check */
00209   if (list == NULL)
00210     I_punt ("is_in_Func_Name_List: list is NULL!");
00211 
00212   /* Get relevant length of func_name */
00213   len = relevant_len (func_name);
00214 
00215   /* Expect to be >= 1 */
00216   if (len < 1)
00217     {
00218       I_punt ("is_in_Func_Name_List: '%s' has relevant length %i!",
00219               func_name, len);
00220     }
00221 
00222   table = (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *) list;
00223   if (CHAR_ARRAY_find_symbol (table, func_name, len) != NULL)
00224     return (1);
00225   else
00226     return (0);
00227 }
